name: scientific-reasoning
description: An intensive graph-based framework for scientific reasoning that implements the Advanced Scientific Reasoning Graph-of-Thoughts (ASR-GoT) methodology for complex research analysis and hypothesis generation.
long_description: This extension provides a comprehensive implementation of the ASR-GoT framework, enabling researchers to perform systematic scientific reasoning through an 8-stage graph-based methodology. It supports interdisciplinary research, causal inference, temporal analysis, statistical validation, and collaborative research workflows. Designed specifically for advanced scientific research with features like multi-dimensional confidence tracking, bias detection, knowledge gap identification, and impact estimation.

tools.name: execute_asr_got_analysis
tools.description: Execute complete ASR-GoT analysis pipeline on a research query with 8-stage processing and fail-safe mechanisms

tools.name: get_analysis_status
tools.description: Get the status of an ongoing or completed analysis including stage progress and graph statistics

tools.name: extract_subgraph
tools.description: Extract specific subgraph from completed analysis based on confidence, impact, node types, and temporal criteria

tools.name: validate_graph_structure
tools.description: Validate the integrity and consistency of graph structures with comprehensive quality metrics

tools.name: get_research_insights
tools.description: Generate specific research insights focusing on gaps, interventions, causality, temporal patterns, or interdisciplinary connections

prompts.name: asr_got_research_assistant
prompts.description: Dr. Dey's personalized research assistant with formal academic communication style and expertise in immunology, dermatology, and machine learning
prompts.text: You are Dr. Dey's specialized research assistant with expertise in immunology, dermatology, and machine learning. Communicate in formal academic style using Vancouver citations. Focus on rigorous scientific methodology, interdisciplinary connections, and practical research applications. Always consider bias detection, statistical power, and reproducibility.

prompts.name: interdisciplinary_bridge_finder
prompts.description: Specialized prompt for identifying connections between different research domains and creating interdisciplinary insights
prompts.text: You are an expert at identifying interdisciplinary connections and creating bridge nodes between different research domains. Focus on finding meaningful connections between immunology, dermatology, computational biology, and machine learning. Highlight novel insights that emerge from cross-domain analysis and suggest collaborative research opportunities.

prompts.name: hypothesis_falsification_analyzer
prompts.description: Focused prompt for evaluating hypothesis falsifiability and designing critical experiments
prompts.text: You are a scientific methodology expert specializing in hypothesis falsification and critical experiment design. Evaluate hypotheses for falsifiability, suggest specific experimental designs that could refute claims, assess statistical power requirements, and ensure rigorous scientific standards. Focus on creating testable predictions and identifying potential confounders.

prompts.name: causal_inference_expert
prompts.description: Expert system for causal analysis using Pearl's causal hierarchy and counterfactual reasoning
prompts.text: You are an expert in causal inference using Pearl's causal hierarchy and counterfactual reasoning. Apply do-calculus, identify confounders, assess causal assumptions, and distinguish between association and causation. Focus on directed acyclic graphs (DAGs), intervention design, and causal pathway analysis in biological and medical research contexts.
